instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_PWM: What is EDP_BKLT_PWM? EDP_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKLT_PWM: What is BKLT_PWM? BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKLT_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no backligt
threads.message:
this board had slight water damage, board turns on no back light ( there is image  , i changed the led driver, 2 times, feed back line is good (A5)     , it have 8.59v on back line line, 
 known good screen,   

i notice <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> 0v 

<RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR>=2.8v 

any idea

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no backligt
threads.message: What voltage do you have on <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>? This sounds like an issue with LED Driver soldering or possibly feedback line on the front side of the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no backligt
threads.message:
Do PRAM reset few times.
If no result, remove <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> and run a wire from <RESISTOR>R7715</RESISTOR> to <CAPACITOR>C7704</CAPACITOR>.
Let see if backlight appears.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no backligt
threads.message:
I did that remove <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> and and run wire from <RESISTOR>R7715</RESISTOR> to caps still no back light 

third time i changed the drive now a5 feed back pin burn out

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no backligt
threads.message:
Be sure to have good continuity for FB line; check XW7720 integrity.
However, <SIGNAL>BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> signal should have some voltage before.
You didn't post its value after modded.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no backligt
threads.message: finally fixed, feed back was bad , thanks for help SOLVED!!!
